newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo rubber futures end mostly up on weak yen.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo rubber futures end mostly up on weak yen.

text.p: Tokyo rubber futures settled mostly firmer on Thursday in sluggish trade, supported by the yen's weakness against the dollar, traders said.
Prices ranged from 0.1 yen per kg easier to 0.5 yen higher. Benchmark March was 0.5 yen up at 135.0 yen.
Activity was mainly dominated by position-adjustment ahead of the spot expiry on Friday.
"The market lacked fresh incentives except for the currency market. Market players hope the spot expiry on Friday can provide direction to the market," one trader said.
